entry.title: Shinjuku Trains • 新宿の電車
entry.content:
Something different on this last shot from Japan (for a while)...

Some of the many local trains going in and out of Tokyo's Shinjuku Station, in this multiple exposure.

More passengers than any station in the world pass through the hundreds of ticket gates spread across this sprawling station.

entry.title: Tokyo Station at Night • 東京駅丸の内口

link.title: Tokyo Station at Night • 東京駅丸の内口

entry.content:
Continuing our tour of Japan train stations, this is the Marunouchi side of Tokyo Station in the rain this evening.

Opened in 1914, damaged by US bombing during WWII, then finally restored to its original state in 2012, the Marunouchi Entrance is a beautiful example of Western-influenced Japanese architecture from the beginning of the 20th Century.

Tokyo Station is the main destination for intercity travel, but other stations in Tokyo have more traffic.

entry.title: Osaka Station • 大阪駅
entry.content:
JR Osaka Station features a giant angled roof covering the tracks, higher on one side than the other; connected to several high rise towers, one of which features a small farm on the roof.

Together with the Hankyu Umeda station across the street, Osaka is the fourth busiest train station in the world.

entry.title: Osaka Castle at Night • 夜の大阪城

link.title: Osaka Castle at Night • 夜の大阪城

entry.content:
Went to Osaka to get a more definitive photograph of Osaka Castle, and I think this shot will serve that need nicely.

It is rather difficult to shoot actually, because the castle is lit so brightly at night. It required an HDR stack - three photos at different exposures, merged together - and much adjusting of different areas of the photo to create a pleasing balance.

entry.title: Nishiki Beach • 二色の浜水浴場

link.title: Nishiki Beach • 二色の浜水浴場

entry.content:
I have been enjoying living in Kyoto, but I've missed watching a sunset on the beach. So yesterday I went to Nishiki Beach, near Kansai Airport in Osaka for this photo.

This is looking northwest across Osaka Bay at Kobe, from southern Osaka Prefecture. The sign on the shack says it’s a boat landing; as well as offering rental parasols, beach yoga and pilates.

entry.title: Osawa Pond • 大沢池
entry.content:
Above, a view of Osawa Ike Pond and Daikaku-ji Temple this morning from my drone.

Below, a 180 degree panorama of the Kitasaga area, looking northeast from approximately the same location as the photo above. Daikaku-ji and Osawa Pond are at the left. You can see the farms in this area and the larger Hirosawa Pond (広沢池) in the distance. The buildings at right are Kitasaga High School.
